title: [BEAM-8079] Move release Gradle build to a Jenkins job (Part - 1)
body:
Reuse existing Jenkins machine to verify release Gradle build can get rid of painful environment setup in `verify_release_branch.sh`. Make it to a Jenkins job can also remove the restriction of the platform. Originally, the environment setup is specific to Linux-like system. This Jenkins job can be used by release manager to verify Gradle build against a release branch. To do so, release manager needs to create a test PR against release branch (instead of master). TODO: Update `verify_release_branch.sh` to use `script.config`. And also release guide. +R: @yifanzou ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7864] Simplify/generalize Spark reshuffle translation
body:
The previous implementation of reshuffle on the portable Spark runner made assumptions about its inputs that proved false when running some Python pipelines. This new translation is made more general to fix that. Edit: decided to simplify the translation for the legacy runner too. title: [BEAM-7967] Execute portable Flink application jar
body:
Adds main method so portable Flink jars (created in #9331) can be executed on a Flink cluster via `flink run`, `java -jar`, etc. Also adds an integration test for jar creation and execution as a postcommit. R: @angoenka @robertwb @tweise ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-8036] disable failed Postcommit Test
body:
Relevant java call stack: ``` java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.bigquery.BigQueryHelpers.parseTableSpec(Ljava/lang/String;)Lorg/apache/beam/repackaged/sql/com/google/api/services/bigquery/model/TableReference; at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.meta.provider.bigquery.BigQueryTable.getRowCountFromBQ(BigQueryTable.java:100) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.meta.provider.bigquery.BigQueryTable.getTableStatistics(BigQueryTable.java:63) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.impl.BeamCalciteTable.getStatistic(BeamCalciteTable.java:91) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.impl.BeamCalciteTable.getStatistic(BeamCalciteTable.java:46) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.prepare.RelOptTableImpl.getMonotonicity(RelOptTableImpl.java:341) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.TableNamespace.getMonotonicity(TableNamespace.java:79) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.IdentifierNamespace.validateImpl(IdentifierNamespace.java:223) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.AbstractNamespace.validate(AbstractNamespace.java:84) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateNamespace(SqlValidatorImpl.java:995) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateQuery(SqlValidatorImpl.java:955) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateFrom(SqlValidatorImpl.java:3109) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateFrom(SqlValidatorImpl.java:3091) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateSelect(SqlValidatorImpl.java:3363) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SelectNamespace.validateImpl(SelectNamespace.java:60) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.AbstractNamespace.validate(AbstractNamespace.java:84) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateNamespace(SqlValidatorImpl.java:995) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateQuery(SqlValidatorImpl.java:955) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.SqlSelect.validate(SqlSelect.java:216) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validateScopedExpression(SqlValidatorImpl.java:930) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.sql.validate.SqlValidatorImpl.validate(SqlValidatorImpl.java:637) at org.apache.beam.repackaged.sql.org.apache.calcite.prepare.PlannerImpl.validate(PlannerImpl.java:215) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.impl.CalciteQueryPlanner.convertToBeamRel(CalciteQueryPlanner.java:144) at org.apache.beam.sdk.extensions.sql.impl.BeamSqlEnv.parseQuery(BeamSqlEnv.java:103) ``` It might because of this [relocation](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/extensions/sql/build.gradle#L49), which is the change used for making zetasql jar work. The problem is we haven't found a resolution for it by changing build.gradle. For example, we tried exclude relocation for `com.google.api.services`, which didn't help (any help on this idea will be appreciated). Vendor Calcite could help because if we have vendor calcite, we can separate zetasql to another package with its own relocation. However by doing so we need wait for vendor calcite effort. @apilloud suggests we revert Beam ZetaSQL PR. I would more leaning to ignore this IT test for now. R: @kennknowles What do you think? Is there a better option? cc: @Ardagan ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8023] Add value provider interfaces for BigQueryIO.Read using Method.DIRECT_READ
body:
This change modifies the interfaces used to specify table read options when reading from BigQuery using Method.DIRECT_READ. It allows the selected fields list and SQL row restriction to be specified using value providers rather than static parameters, and marks as deprecated the previous interface which allows users to specify a TableReadOptions proto directly. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6114] Calcite Rules to Select Type of Join in BeamSQL
body:
Calcite Rules: BeamSideInputJoinRule, BeamSideInputLookupJoinRule, BeamCoGBKJoinRule are added to select the type of Join instead of Selecting the Join in the Expansion of PTransform. Since SideInputLookupJoin condition may collide with SideInputJoin and StandardJoin, if any of the inputs of Join is Seekable, BeamSideInputJoinRule and BeamCoGBKJoinRule will not be matched. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-8019] Several changes to support cross-language transforms on DataflowRunner
body:
Contains following changes. Didn't break these up into separate PRs since these are small changes but lemme know if I should. * Python SDK's current implementation requires one output to be identified as the main output. But external transforms do not identify a main output and I don't think this is required for execution of the transforms. So updated the code to pick one output tag of external transforms to be the main output tag. * Updates Python SDK to not to override the main output tag for external ParDo transforms. Java SDK in some cases requires the main output tag of ParDo transforms to not to change to operate correctly. * Updated TestPipeline to be able to provide additional pipeline options. This is is helpful when integration testing cross-language pipelines. * Fixed a bug when comparing environments in RunnerAPIPTransformHolder.to_runner_api() method. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8015] Get logs from Docker containers
body:
- Log Docker output both when the container fails to start up, and when it is closed normally. - In order to get logs for stopped (failed) containers, don't use the `rm` option for `docker run`, which deletes containers before we can inspect what happened to them. Instead, call `docker rm` ourselves to clean up the container only after we log its logs. (Behavior for `--retain_docker_container` stays the same.) - Remove a bit of dead code in Docker container startup. Apologies for complicating the test setup -- I wanted to parameterize to make sure we're covering all the cases. title: [BEAM-7909] upgrade python lib versions to match to dataflow worker
body:
This PR is upgrading python library versions to match versions installed at dataflow workers. (https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/concepts/sdk-worker-dependencies) In order to make it easy to track down in case anything is broken, I created a separate PR for this change. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-8018] Detect unexported fields earlier
body:
Values of unregistered types in the Beam Go SDK are synthetically constructed with the reflect package. However, it's not possible to synthetically construct types with unexported fields with reflect.StructOf. This can be worked around by registering the given type, which avoids the expensive synthetic construction and this failure mode. The failure manifests at pipeline execution time which is worse. This PR moves that failure to pipeline construction time, where it presently manifests as a panic (until BEAM-8017 is resolved) with instructions how to register the type. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-8011] Remove workaround to run unbounded sources in portable pipelines
body:
In the course of BEAM-6730 we added a way to Runner-translate Reads in portable pipelines. GreedyPipelineFuser was manipulated to let through Reads to the Runner. The better solution for this problem would have been to remove the environment from unbounded reads, which will make it a Runner translated transform. If in the future we support unbounded reads via a SDF adapter, we can re-add the environment. title: [BEAM-8010] Remove translation of bounded reads from portable Flink Runner
body:
In the course of BEAM-6730 we added a way to Runner-translate bounded and unbounded Reads in portable pipelines. However, bounded Reads are already supported via Impulse + BoundedReadViaImpulse. This can be fixed by removing the bounded read translators from portable pipelines. title: [BEAM-8004] Fix flaky Flink load tests
body:
The tests are failing due to an issue with scaling down a dataproc cluster. `gcloud dataproc clusters update` command can delete a node which runs a job manager. This results in a UnknownHostException being raised. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7993] wait longer for docker container startup
body:
Previous previous behavior: wait 2 minutes x infinite retries for container to start up Previous behavior: wait 1 minute for docker container to start up, then immediately throw an exception, killing the job New behavior: wait 2 minutes x 5 retries for container to start up before failing. R: @angoenka ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-8006] Add retracting to windowing strategy translation.
body:
Follow up work of BEAM-7965. Note that this PR hasn't exposed retracting mode to users, in other words, users cannot specify retracting mode after this PR in Java SDK. To really expose retracting mode for users, it will require a change at [Window.java](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/windowing/Window.java), which will happen much later. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-5428] Implement Runner support for cache tokens
body:
This adds support for sending cache tokens for state requests from the SDK. Cache tokens are managed by the StateRequestHandler implemented by the Runner. User state cache tokens are valid for the lifetime of a Runner<=>SDK Harness connection. If the application fails for any reason, (e.g. error in user code, failed checkpointing, etc.) the cache token must be renewed. title: [BEAM-7999] Fix BigQuery timestamp handling for Schema Aware PCollection
body:
This fixes the handling of timestamps when reading for BigQuery. As it
was assumed BigQuery always outputs a Double, reading a table directly
outputs a textual version in the JSON. This is now handled. Also the
from Beam Row also outputs the BigQuery textual version, iso the ISO
standard representation, this makes the implementation symmetric.

_Tested on DirectRunner and DataflowRunner_

title: [BEAM-7994] Fixing unsafe pointer usage for Go 1.13

title: [BEAM-7990] Add ability to read parquet files into PCollection<pyarrow.Table>
body:
Adds `ReadFromParquetBatched` and `ReadAllFromParquetBatched` to `apache_beam.io.parquetio`. This moves the logic to split pyarrow.Table instances into python dictionaries out of `_ParquetSource` and into a new `_ArrowTableToRowDictionaries(DoFn)`. The original `ReadFromParquet` expands to `Read(source) | ParDo(_ArrowTableToRowDictionaries)` while `ReadFromParquetBatched` just reads directly from the source. Because many of the tests operate on the source directly and not the actual IO transforms, they had to be modified to compare the output with the expected pyarrow Tables. This also created an issue with `apache_beam.testing.util.equal_to` - because `pyarrow.Table` instances don't sort deterministically, the faster comparison approach doesn't work correctly. This PR also modifies `equal_to` to verify inequality with the "slower" approach. My reasoning is that most test results will be a true positive, and just the faster approach can be used, so this shouldn't have a substantial effect on performance. title: [BEAM-7989] Remove side inputs from CacheVisitor calculation
body:
The sideInput PCollectionViews of a DoFn cause SparkRunner.CacheVisitor to increment the cacheCandidate for the PCollection that underlies the PCollectionView. The SparkRunner does not access those underlying PCollections when performing a DoFn, they are only accessed once in the View.CreatePCollectionView Transform. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7986] Upgrade grpcio
body:
#8708 introduced a call to close the gRPC channel, which was introduced in grpcio 1.12. Tested manually using (once with grpcio 1.11 and once with 1.12.1; the former fails and the latter succeeds): ``` python setup.py nosetests --tests apache_beam.io.gcp.pubsub_integration_test:PubSubIntegrationTest.test_streaming_data_only --test-pipeline-options='--runner=TestDirectRunner --project=foo' ``` Removed comment about protobuf version since grpcio no longer depends on it. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7909] Python3 docker containers
body:
This PR is to support customized container for Python. Documents: [beam-customized-container](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iW67A8S9PPgTyrPik9NmjfYiXoBqnNHdzwpX0CmyfsI/edit#) It resolves several Jira issues. **[[BEAM-7907] Support customized container for Python](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-7909)** This is a main issue this PR is trying to resolve. **[[BEAM-7474] Add SDK harness containers for Py 3.6, Py 3.7](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-7474)** This PR introduces minor version of docker containers, so this issue became part of this work. **[[BEAM-7875] Unskip test running on FnApi Subprocess Runner](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-7875)** This is a minor change, so I included to this PR, please let me know if it'd be better to create a separate PR for this issue. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [SQL] Add support for custom table name resolution
body:
This adds a framework and a usage example for custom table name resolution. This can be helpful when users expect to write queries referencing tables using Calcite's dotted notation but a metadata service expects a single call with a full table id. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-5164]: Add documentation for ParquetIO.
body:
(See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5164 for discussion.) ParquetIO will fail when using Spark 2.2 and 2.3, since it relies on an API introduced in Parquet 1.10.0. Spark 2.4 is unaffected. Unfortunately, we can't/shouldn't relocate the parquet packages for two reasons: (1) The Parquet CompressionCodec is exposed in the API, and (2) Parquet 1.10.0 depends on Avro 1.8.2 which would also require relocating. The documented workaround is pretty simple and (in lieu of an actual fix) can unblock a user. **R:** @lgajowy Could you take a look? ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7977] use LOG.info instead of System.out.println in DataflowRunner
body:
DataflowRunner writes two lines to stdout, bypassing the regular logger. This diff aligns this by logging info statements instead. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. body:

This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7966] Write portable Flink application jar
body:
This is the first half of the implementation outlined [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kj_9JWxGWOmSGeZ5hbLVDXSTv-zBrx4kQRqOq85RYD4/edit#). This PR will enable any job with the `--output_executable_path` flag set, when sent to the Flink job server, to be output as an jar. Adding the main method to the jar produced here (or any jar with the same format) will be a separate PR. R: @angoenka @robertwb @tweise ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7969] Report FnAPI counters as deltas in streaming jobs.
body:
FnAPI counters were not reported in streaming worker. Streaming Dataflow jobs do not tie counters to workitems, but report them as deltas on same workitem instead. This change picks only latest counters per workitem from FnAPI harness, treats them as updates and reports to DFE. [Tested manually at this point] ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7959] Simplify use of Gradle property and task in Python
body:
Simplify Python Gradle scripts and also unify task dependency style. - Remove `project.` and `project.ext.` prefix when reference project property and external property in build scripts. - Use `dependsOn 'otherTask'` for task dependency declaration. One line per task. Note: No test configuration/action should be affected by this changes. Only change on language style. +R: @lukecwik +cc: @udim @tvalentyn ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). body:
Removes perfkit usage from JDBC, HadoopFromat and HDFS file based ioit tests. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [CHERRY-PICK][BEAM-7916] Add ElasticsearchIO query parameter to take a ValueProvider (#9285)
body:
Cherry-picked from `release-2.14.0`, where it was merged by mistake. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).
